channel.title: Need help - read
channel.description: Hi everyone. I need help. I'm trying to get silab client or ANY client that's 317. Any clients supporting Linux users (ubuntu)? I'm really in need of one..thank you :)

item.title: Need help - read
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

[quote=“pklobbys, post:4, topic:233986”]I have Java. I just need the .sh file for it…

It’s annoying how people say “If your on linux you should know, elsewhere you shouldnt be on linux”
…Everyone has been new to Linux I believe…[/quote]Don’t try programming on a OS your not familiar with? And you don’t need a .sh file, you can enter the commands via terminal…

Read full topic

You don’t need an .sh file to run your client… use the terminal

item.title: Need help - read
item.dc:creator: @Al_red Alƒred
item.description:
@Al_red wrote:

All clients should support Linux, since they are programmed in Java… Make sure you hava Java Installed… Since your using Ubuntu, You’ll need to go to java.sun.com and download the JDK, then use alien, or something like that…

Anyway, if your using linux you should know how to do that, if you don’t you should be able to figure out on your own.

Read full topic

item.title: Need help - read
item.dc:creator: @bigh51 bigh51
item.description:
@bigh51 wrote:

Did you just ask on MOPARSCAPE how to run a java program on LINUX? Moparscapers don’t even know how to run a java program on WINDOWS, let alone LINUX… Try looking on google.

Read full topic
